steps.text: Put on protective eyewear.
Wear hearing protection.
Put on respirator.
Wear protective clothing.
Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Remove all mold release materials.
Prepare the boat wash and high performance cloth.
Use the boat wash and high performance cloth to clean the boat.
Sand the old or new gelcoat using a DA sander with 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II abrasive discs, grade 80+.
Apply dry guide coat to the surface and re-sand for an even texture.
Clean the repair area using approved cleaner or blow off with pressured air.
Use 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II Abrasive Discs and 3M™ Sander for cleaning.
Apply 3M™ Hookit™ Soft Interface Pad and 3M™ Dry Guide Coat.
If needed, mix 3M™ Marine Blister Repair Filler.
Apply the filled material to fill 85% of the cavity.
Wait for 30 minutes.
Feather the repair with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron² II abrasive disc, grade 80+.
Apply dry guide coat.
Re-sand.
Clean the area.
Mix 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Apply the mixed filler, starting with a tight coat.
Sand with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubiton² II grade 120+ abrasive discs after filler has cured.
Use 3M™ Marine Blister Repair Filler, 3M™ Marine Premium Filler, and 3M™ Dry Guide Coat in the given order.
Sand the repair area with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron²² TM II grade 220+.
Use a 3M™ Sander for sanding.
Ensure the surface is completely dry.
Mask areas with 3M™ Precision Masking Tape.
Back up masked areas with 3M™ Performance Industrial Masking Tape 301E or 3M Scotch® Performance Masking Tape 244.
Mask the entire surface with 3M™ Purple Premium Plus Masking Film.
Apply 3M™ Tapes as needed.
Mix gelcoat in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 disposable spray cup.
Adjust 3M™ Performance Spray Gun settings.
Hold spray gun 15cm-20cm from the surface and apply gelcoat.
Use 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 Spray Cup System, 3M™ Performance Spray Gun, and 3M™ Performance Gravity HVLP Atomising Head.
Refer to the gelcoat finishing process on pages 3 and 4.
Follow a 6-step gelcoat finishing process.
Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Second step: Unspecified.
Sand with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 320+ abrasive.
Sand with 400+ grade abrasive.
Check surface condition and use P800 grade abrasive if needed.
Refine the P800 grade sand scratch using P1200 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Apply P1200 grade sand to refine the previous scratch.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound.
Use a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm with a 3M™ Perfect-It™ Low Linting Wool Compounding Pad.
Polish with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish and a wool compounding pad at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area and wipe clean before it dries.
Sand
Scratch refine sanding
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish.
Use a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Next ordered action.
Use a DA sander with 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 80+ grade abrasive discs to sand the surface.
Clean the surface after sanding.
Apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Apply dry guide coat.
Sand with 120+ grade.
Sand with 220+ grade.
Clean the surface.
Ensure the surface is dry.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix primer in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup.
Apply primer with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Hold spray gun 15cm-20cm from surface.
Apply dry guide coat.
Sand the primer with 320+ grade abrasive discs.
Repeat sanding with 400+ grade.
Clean the surface.
Mix paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup.
Apply paint with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Refer to the following page for the finishing process.
Marine Paint and Clearcoat Finishing Process.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Second step: Unspecified.
Sand with 3M™ Hookit™ Purple Finishing Film Disc 260L+ P1200/1500 grade using a DA sander and soft interface pad (Dry method).
Sand with 3M™ Trizact™ Hookit™ Clear Coat Sanding Disc grade 1500 using a DA sander and soft interface pad, applying a light mist of water (Wet method).
Refine P1200 scratches with 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Disc P2000 grade.
Refine P1500 scratches with 3M™ Trizact™ Hookit™ Foam Abrasive Disc 443SA grade 3000.
Use a light mist of water during the wet refinement process.
Clean the surface.
Compound.
Compound with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Fast Cut Plus Extreme.
Use a rotary polisher.
Use a 3M™ wool or green foam compounding pad.
Polish the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Ultrafina SE Polish.
Use a 3M™ wool or blue foam polishing pad.
Operate the polisher at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area.
Wipe the wax clean before it dries.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Second step: 2.
Sand the bottom surface using a dual-action sander.
Use 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron² II 220+ grade abrasive.
Clean the area.
Mix and apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Let it cure.
Sand with 120+ grade abrasive.
Finish with 220+ grade.
Ensure the surface is dry.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix bottom paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup.
Remove lid filter from the cup.
Use a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Hold the spray gun 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Evaluate suitability of 3M product for application.
Conduct workplace hazard assessment.
Follow all applicable regulations (e.g., OSHA, ANSI).
Select product with appropriate safety equipment.
Use selected product with safety equipment.
Products should not be used for consumer purposes without explicit permission.
Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations when using products.
Consult a safety professional or visit www.3M.com.
Contact 3M UK plc for assistance in Automotive Aftermarket.
Provide contact details: 3M Centre, Cain Road, Bracknell, RG12 8HT, Phone: +44 (0)161 237 6391, Email: aadukenquiries@mmm.com, Website: www.3M.co.uk/paintapplication.
Contact 3M Ireland Limited for assistance in Automotive Aftermarket.
Provide contact details: The Iveagh Building, The Park, Carrickmines, Dublin 18, Phone: +353 12160301, Email: aadukenquiries@mmm.com, Website: www.3M.co.uk/paintapplication.

constraints.text: Customer is solely responsible for product selection and use.
Failure to follow procedure may result in injury, sickness, death, and/or property damage.
Disclaimer: 3M industrial products are intended for trained industrial and occupational customers for workplace use.
Products are not intended for consumer use, except in specified cases, and must adhere to health and safety regulations.
